snippet: Georg Solti, who would have turned 100 this month, found harmony among musicians and thought diplomats should be able to achieve the same among governments.
abstract: Venerable conductor Georg Solti, who found harmony among musicians, once pondered that diplomats should be able to achieve the same among governments; two concerts by the World Orchestra for Peace commemorate the 100th anniversary of Solti's birth, one at Carnegie Hall in New York City and the second at Symphony Center in Chicago.
lead_paragraph: Georg Solti, who would have turned 100 this month, found harmony among musicians and thought diplomats should be able to achieve the same among governments.

headline.seo: Memories of Georg Solti as His Orchestra Comes to Town
headline.main: The Conductor With an Ear for Peace
headline.print_headline: The Conductor With an Ear For Peace
